events.name: trayClickLaunchedApp
events.summary: Fired when a tray notification is shown and the application is not running. Touching it launches the app, and fires this event.

properties.name: payload
properties.summary: A JSON string of your data payload. Use JSON.parse to turn this in to an object you can use.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: trayClickFocusedApp
events.summary: Fired when a tray notification is shown and the application is already running. Touching it focuses the app, and fires this event.

properties.name: payload
properties.summary: A JSON string of your data payload. Use JSON.parse to turn this in to an object you can use.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: deviceTokenExpired
events.summary: Fired when last retrieved token has become invalid.
events.description:
Fired when the last retrieved device token has expired and has become invalid, meaning the token can no longer be used to send push notifications. You'll need to call retrieveDeviceToken again to acquire a new token.

This typically occurs when:

  • The Firebase "Instance ID" has been deleted.
  • The app is restored from backup on a different device.
  • The app has been uninstalled and re-installed.
  • The end-user clears the app's data.

events.name: callback
events.summary: Fired whenever a push notification is received. If your application is not running when a push is received, the push will be saved in a queue until the next time you add an event listener for this.

properties.name: payload
properties.summary: A JSON string of your data payload. Use JSON.parse to turn this in to an object you can use.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: clearStatus
methods.summary: A method to clear stored Push status including Push type, device token, GCM SenderId, etc. This method is useful for changing GCM SenderId when needed. After calling this app, Push will be reinitialized, and please start to get device token again.

methods.name: retrieveDeviceToken
methods.summary: Asynchronously retrieves the device token that you should use for any calls to the Appcelerator Cloud Service's subscribe or unsubscribe to push notification channels. This token is unique to each application, and each device.

parameters.name: arg
parameters.summary: An object holding callbacks for success or failure

properties.name: debug
properties.summary: A boolean value indicating whether debug output is enabled or not

properties.name: enabled
properties.summary: Setting 'enabled' is not required for GCM; it is sufficient to only call 'retrieveDeviceToken'.

properties.name: focusAppOnPush
properties.summary: Whether or not your application is brought to the foreground whenever a new push is received.

properties.name: pushType
properties.summary: The name of the push type used.

properties.name: showAppOnTrayClick
properties.summary: Whether or not clicking the tray notification will bring your application to the foreground. This is only applicable if you have set "showTrayNotification" to true.

properties.name: showTrayNotification
properties.summary: Whether or not to show a tray notification when a new push is received. If your payload is only a string, it will be used as the contentText and tickerText, and your application's name will be used as the contentTitle with a system icon.

properties.name: showTrayNotificationsWhenFocused
properties.summary: Whether or not to show tray notifications when your application is in the foreground.

properties.name: singleCallback
properties.summary: Sets whether to trigger a single callback for multiple queued push notifications. Set to true to process multiple queued push notification in one callback.
